com.xilinx.rapidwright.design

Class Port

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.design.Port
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Port
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    This class represents the ports used to define the interfaces of modules in XDL. They consist of a unique name, the instance to which they are connected and a pin name on the instance.
    Author:
    Chris Lavin Created on: Jun 22, 2010
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean isOutputPort
      Flag to be used when no pin is available denoting direction of port
      private java.lang.String name
      Name of the Port of the current module, this is the port of an instance in the module.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> passThruPortNames
      List of port names this port connects directly to (pass-thru connections)
      private Pin pin
      This is the pin that the port references.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      private PortType type
      Port type (provided by metadata)
      private float worstCasePortDelay
      Worst case delay in or out of the port in nanoseconds

      • Port

        public Port(java.lang.String name,
            boolean isOutputPort,
            java.lang.String initialPassThruPinName)
        Special constructor when creating a port that has a pass-thru connection
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the port on the module
        isOutputPin - Flag denoting if this port is an output or input
        initialPassThruPinName - The name of the pass-thru port this port connects to
